detaileddescription.para: simple_hash_func: A template hash function, which considers the hash key as a polynom

A template hash function, which considers the hash key as a polynom. we are supposed to managed string written with ht->alphabet_length different characters We turn the string into a binary by computing str[0]+str[1]*ht->alphabet_length+str[2]*ht->alphabet_length**2 + ... ... + str[N]*ht->alphabet_length**N Then we keep the modulo by index_size. This size has to be a prime integer for performance reason The polynome is computed with the Horner's method.

parameterdescription.para: the parameter structure that was used to define the hashtable
the key to compute the hash value on

detaileddescription.para: double_hash_func: This function is used for double hashing, based on another hash function.

This functions uses the hash function contained in hparam to compute a first hash value, then use it to compute a second value like this: h = ( firsthash + ( 8 - ( firsthash % 8 ) ) ) % hparam.index_size This operation just changes the last 3 bits, but it can be demonstrated that this produced a more efficient and better balanced hash function (See 'Algorithm in C', Robert Sedjewick for more detail on this).

parameterdescription.para: the parameter structure that was used to define the hashtable
the key to compute the hash value on

detaileddescription.para: rbt_hash_func: Another hash junction, but to be used for the red-black trees managed internally.

This library uses red-black trees to store data. RB trees use key data too. The hash function has to be different than the one used for find the RB Tree, if not all the entry in the tree will have the same hash value which will lead to a very unbalanced tree

parameterdescription.para: the parameter structure that was used to define the hashtable
the key to compute the hash value on

detaileddescription.para: PreAllocPdata: Does the allocation of a groups of hash_data_t to be managed as RBT_OPAQ values.
Does the allocation of a groups of hash_data_t to be managed as RBT_OPAQ values.

parameterdescription.para: number of pdata to be pre-allocated

simplesect.para: A pointer to the list of allocated pdata of NULL if allocation failed

detaileddescription.para: PreAllocNode: Does the allocation of a groups of nodes to be managed by the RB Tree
Does the allocation of a groups of nodes to be managed by the RB Tree.

parameterdescription.para: number of rbt-node to be pre-allocated

simplesect.para: A pointer to the list of allocated nodes of NULL if allocation failed

memberdef.argsstring: (hash_table_t *ht, hash_buffer_t *buffkey, unsigned int hashval, int rbt_value, struct rbt_node **ppnode)
memberdef.name: Key_Locate

detaileddescription.para: Key_Locate: Locate a buffer key in the hash table, as a rbt node.
This function is for internal use only

parameterdescription.para: the hashtable to be used.
a pointeur to an object of type hash_buffer_t which describe the key location in memory.
hash value associated with the key (in order to avoid computing it a second time)
rbt value associated with the key (in order to avoid computing it a second time)
if successfull,will point to the pointer to the rbt node to be used

simplesect.para: HASHTABLE_NO_SUCH_KEY if key was not found

detaileddescription.para: HashTable_Init: Init the Hash Table.
Init the Hash Table .

parameterdescription.para: A structure of type hash_parameter_t which contains the values used to init the hash table.

simplesect.para: NULL if init failed, the pointeur to the hashtable otherwise.

detaileddescription.para: HashTable_Test_And_Set: set a pair (key,value) into the Hash Table.
Set a (key,val) couple in the hashtable .

parameterdescription.para: the hashtable to be used.
a pointeur to an object of type hash_buffer_t which describe the key location in memory.
a pointeur to an object of type hash_buffer_t which describe the value location in memory.
a switch to tell if the entry is to be tested or overwritten or not

simplesect.para: HASHTABLE_INSERT_MALLOC_ERROR if an error occured during the insertion process.

detaileddescription.para: HashTable_Get: Try to retrieve the value associated with a key.
Try to retrieve the value associated with a key. The structure buffval will point to the object found if successfull.

parameterdescription.para: the hashtable to be used.
a pointeur to an object of type hash_buffer_t which describe the key location in memory.
a pointeur to an object of type hash_buffer_t which describe the value location in memory.

simplesect.para: HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY is the key was not found.

detaileddescription.para: HashTable_Del: Remove a (key,val) couple from the hashtable.
Remove a (key,val) couple from the hashtable. The parameter buffkey contains the key which describes the object to be removed from the hash table.

parameterdescription.para: the hashtable to be used.
a pointeur to an object of type hash_buffer_t which describe the key location in memory.
the key data buffer that was associated with this entry. Not considered if equal to NULL.

simplesect.para: HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY is the key was not found.

detaileddescription.para: HashTable_GetStats: Computes statistiques on the hashtable
Print information about the hashtable (mostly for debugging purpose).

parameterdescription.para: the hashtable to be used.
pointer to the result

detaileddescription.para: HashTable_GetSize: Gets the number of entries in the hashtable.
Gets the number of entries in the hashtable.

parameterdescription.para: the hashtable to be used.

detaileddescription.para: HashTable_Print: Print information about the hashtable (mostly for debugging purpose).
Print information about the hashtable (mostly for debugging purpose).

parameterdescription.para: the hashtable to be used.

briefdescription.para: Gestion des tables de hachage a base de Red/Black Trees.
